line_2: And greater cunning, forc'd the rest to serve

line_1: The mind releas'd from too constrain'd a nerve,
line_2: Then like a bow long forc'd into a curve,

line_1: " I wish there was no such a Thing as a Nerve;
line_2: "— Oh FITCHET — don't ask me — good Heavens preserve,

line_1: That when you've wound up every nerve
line_2: But this you must with care observe,

line_1: And think, what pangs would rack each throbbing nerve,
line_2: If God should judge us, as our faults deserve!
